page.title: 17FORESTRY PLANTATIONS
page.content: Thwaites Plantation is a 6 Hectare area of 24 yr old Scots Pine & Lodgepole Pine trees. It is a Forestry Commission thicket stage plantation much used as a latrine by those following the Lyke Wake Walk - for which purpose stiles have now been erected. The fences that are at the roadside suffer occasional damage from vehicles. Part of this block is to be sold to the N Yorks Moors National Park Cttee. for development as a car park. On Cringle Moor there is a 12.5 Hectare plantation of Scots Pine, Lodgepole Pine & Sitka Spruce. The first two have suffered predation by sheep so the Sitka has a stock fence. A recently opened footpath cuts through the Sitka at the S end. Where the trees have not blocked out all light, rank bracken takes over. The area is generally impenetrable.
